description: Goat's beard (Aruncus aethusifolius) is an amazing species of flowering plant which produces a beautiful fountain-like display of curved plumes. Its abundant cream-white flowers bloom in late spring to mid summer, adding an element of interest to the landscape. On top of its elegant appearance, goat's beard features a glossy green foliage and long-lived seed heads that add texture and color to the outdoor setting. Additionally, this hardy perennial is low maintenance, easy to grow, and can often be found growing in woodland and meadow settings due to its preferences for moist, rich soils and partial to full-sun exposure. With its stunning looks and tough constitution, goat's beard is sure to add beauty to any garden.
